      The areas of research of the Complex Systems & Soft Matter
      Physics research group are principally in nonlinear dynamics,
      theoretical soft condensed matter physics (including complex
      fluids & polymer physics, bubble dynamics & acoustic
      cavitation), biomechanics, physics of living systems, dynamics of
      coupled neurons, modelling other complex systems including certain
      aspects of climate, climate change impact on ecological systems,
      etc. Several other aspects of theoretical physics are also being
      studied. Details of our research may be found here in the other
      pages.
